Posts.Title: Bioidentical Hormones/Are they out too? Bliz Shirlann

Posts.Content: Jul 19, 2007 03:06PM 2curvy wrote: I had Taxotere and Cytoxin, and received a Neulasta shot the day after chemo. The nurse told me to take Claritin D the day before the Neulasta, and day of, and the day after. This supposedly helped with the pain. However, I did experience alot of pain in my legs and upperback, espcially after the first shot. The subsequent shots caused much less pain that I was able to handle, sometimes taking Advil. Good luck to you!
Posts.Title: Neulastia lady4law lady4law

Posts.Content: Feb 8, 2008 06:22PM 2curvy wrote: This diagnosis is called Triple Negative.  I too am triple negative.  You will most likely be treated with chemotherapy, but there are no follow-up drugs that hormone positve women have. The good thing about triple negative is that it responds very well to chemo, and generally, if it doesn't come back within 3 years, then there is a good chance that it won't come back. There is a whole triple negative board here.  Just scroll down and you will find it.  Good luck to you.

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2008 01:53AM 2curvy wrote: I had TC last year.  Both my eyebrows and eyelashes thinned, but did not fall out completely.  Actually my lashes were sparse, but I wore mascara every day.  They grew back in very fast and they are long, especially my left eye! lol.  They orignally fell out around week 4, grew right back in and then fell out again about 5 months after my last chemo.  They grew in fast.  I also used Revitalash that a friend gave me.  My lahses are long now, maybe because of that!
